reviewText: I saw Tosh in Las Vegas a year ago, and then tonight watched this stand up on Comedy Central - this is exactly the show I remembered from Vegas and was so happy to see I could order it online!  If you are a fan of Tosh and are not easily offended, then you will love this.  Beware though, he's got no boundaries!  Nothing is off limits to Tosh in this one.
Classic Daniel Tosh, enjoyed a ton of laughs watching this!

Very funny, very smart.

However, don't watch if you have problems with sarcasm and hyperbole.  Just remember, it is a show, a scripted act with Daniel Tosh doing his best Daniel Tosh imitation.
This had been on my list for quite some time. And receiving it now was so great! The DVD came in perfect condition and i watched it the same day I recieved it!

If you are a fan of his brash and unapologetic styles, this DVD is for you. It is new material in the vein of his personal tropes. Funny, irreverent, and typical Tosh.
Awesome

Just watched this on a flight to Seattle. I appreciate Tosh's sense of humor and like his stand up far more than his Comedy Central show. There are some jokes that might make some people squirm, but I found it really entertaining. I'd love to see more stand up from him in the future. You can tell that Daniel is a highly intelligent guy and I think that's part of why his comedy works. His timing has also only gotten better over the years.
Five Stars

You have to know Daniel Tosh's style of comedy and appreciate his sense of humor to truly enjoy his comedy shows.  If you are easily offended, this is not the show for you.  I have seen Tosh live, in concert, and laughed nonstop for the entire show.  This hour long special is nearly as good with new material that is really hilarious.  It is not constant laughter, but close.  I have watched it now about 3 or 4 times and still laugh out loud at so many jokes.  His style of comedy just never gets old.

If you love Daniel Tosh, then you'll love this special!  Its some of his best work.
Not his best
"Jokes" about raping women.
Jokes about abortions and killing babies.......

This is my second review of Daniel Tosh's stand-up.  I don't think I did Daniel justice in the last review. With this one, I would like to try a different approach...

 He is so funny.  You ever have those moments in your life where your mind takes a sick and twisted view of the crazy stuff that happens to you (you have to laugh at life otherwise you would die of depression), and you start thinking "wow, if only I could manage to speak about my crazy life in front of an audience, show people the humor in my horrible situation, it could really make a killing at the comedy clubs"?

That is what it's like listening to Daniel Tosh's comedy.  He is the twisted part of yourself who has seen way too much horror in life; the part of yourself that cuts the jokes in your head constantly, just so you don't lose your mind from taking life too seriously.

I watch it, barely able to breathe from laughing so hard, struggling not to pee my pants on my couch, and all the while I am thinking "He must be a soulmate!  Holy c**p, that is so me!".

Daniel is so awesomely funny!  It is an art form to be able to find that much humor in so many facets of life.  There are so very few men who can keep me laughing that hard for that long without some help from alcohol.

Thank you

Absolutely hilarious.  As noted by another reviewer, this one has a dark side to it but it also makes it funnier than all of the others.  IF you are a fan of Tosh you will love this one.  BUT if you have never heard of Tosh / his show / his other specials than be warned that this might not be for you.  Go to comedy central first and watch and episode or 2. If you find that funny then come back here to watch this one.
incredibly funny
I have to say that while most comedians have a wide range of variability in their performances, Daniel nearly always hits the mark.
I laughed from beginning to end. He has gotten better at telling jokes. One of his best comedy specials yet! If you are easily offended or don't have a sense of humor, then this isn't for you!
Laughed the entire time!!!

I want to give this 3.5 stars... When I first saw it on Comedy Central, it was okay at first, but then became shocking and hilarious. The extended version, however? Seemed to drag; I recommend watching the version that aired on television

I drive two hours per day for work, and I listen to a lot of standup comedy (radio and streaming). I've been a fan of Tosh since about 2008 when "Completely Serious" came out (I saw him live during that 'tour'). I believe Tosh is about as "all-star" as standup comedy can be right now, with Bill Burr and Anthony Jeselnik tied for second place. While I loved "Happy Thoughts," I did feel it was a step down from "Completely Serious." So I went into "People Pleaser" with mild expectations.

With "People Pleaser," Tosh is back to form like he was with "Completely Serious." Topics like dead Michael Jackson still making billions, the great things 9/11 created for relationships (his comment "That was worth a tower...NOT TWO" is about as horrifically awful - and therefore hilarious - as ever), the environmental crisis (which, by the way, his "cure" is actually spot-on), and his worst day in traffic, etc. are chock-full of Tosh's trademark awfulness. He even makes jokes out of what people think of him who feel the need to take him seriously (I invite reviews trashing him to listen to that part.. he's a COMEDIAN, and tells JOKES for a living).

If you loved "Completely Serious," don't even hesitate on "People Pleaser." It's some of his best work.

Absolutely hilarious; there is a stretch of about 15 minutes of flawlessly executed jokes. Although he is mostly famous for his Comedy Central show, this special is an excellent reminder that Tosh is first and foremost a razor sharp stand-up comedian.
